5#ifndef V8_SANDBOX_SANDBOX_H_
6#define V8_SANDBOX_SANDBOX_H_

8#include "include/v8-internal.h"
9#include "include/v8-platform.h"
10#include "include/v8config.h"

15namespace v8 {
16namespace internal {
17
18#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
19
43class V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Sandbox {
44 public:
45 // +- ~~~ -+---------------------------------------- ~~~ -+- ~~~ -+
46 // | 32 GB | (Ideally) 1 TB | 32 GB |
47 // | | | |
48 // | Guard | 4 GB : ArrayBuffer backing stores, | Guard |
49 // | Region | V8 Heap : WASM memory buffers, and | Region |
50 // | (front) | Region : any other sandboxed objects. | (back) |
51 // +- ~~~ -+----------------+----------------------- ~~~ -+- ~~~ -+
52 // ^ ^
53 // base end
54 // < - - - - - - - - - - - size - - - - - - - - - - >
55 // < - - - - - - - - - - - - - reservation_size - - - - - - - - - - - - >
56
57 Sandbox() = default;
58
59 Sandbox(const Sandbox&) = delete;
60 Sandbox& operator=(Sandbox&) = delete;
61
74 void Initialize(v8::VirtualAddressSpace* vas);
75
81 void TearDown();
82
86 bool is_initialized() const { return initialized_; }
87
98 bool is_partially_reserved() const { return reservation_size_ < size_; }
99
107 Address base() const { return base_; }
108
114 Address end() const { return end_; }
115
119 size_t size() const { return size_; }
120
128 size_t reservation_size() const { return reservation_size_; }
129
135 v8::VirtualAddressSpace* address_space() const {
136 return address_space_.get();
137 }
138
142 v8::PageAllocator* page_allocator() const {
143 return sandbox_page_allocator_.get();
144 }
145
149 bool Contains(Address addr) const {
150 return base::IsInHalfOpenRange(addr, base_, base_ + size_);
151 }
152
156 bool Contains(void* ptr) const {
157 return Contains(reinterpret_cast<Address>(ptr));
158 }
159
173 bool ReservationContains(Address addr) const {
174 return base::IsInHalfOpenRange(addr, reservation_base_,
175 reservation_base_ + reservation_size_);
176 }
177
178 class SandboxedPointerConstants final {
179 public:
180 Address empty_backing_store_buffer() const {
181 return empty_backing_store_buffer_;
182 }
183 Address empty_backing_store_buffer_address() const {
184 return reinterpret_cast<Address>(&empty_backing_store_buffer_);
185 }
186 void set_empty_backing_store_buffer(Address value) {
187 empty_backing_store_buffer_ = value;
188 }
189
190 void Reset() { empty_backing_store_buffer_ = 0; }
191
192 private:
193 Address empty_backing_store_buffer_ = 0;
194 };
195 const SandboxedPointerConstants& constants() const { return constants_; }
196
197 Address base_address() const { return reinterpret_cast<Address>(&base_); }
198 Address end_address() const { return reinterpret_cast<Address>(&end_); }
199 Address size_address() const { return reinterpret_cast<Address>(&size_); }
200
201 private:
202 // The SequentialUnmapperTest calls the private Initialize method to create a
203 // sandbox without guard regions, which would consume too much memory.
204 friend class SequentialUnmapperTest;
205
206 // These tests call the private Initialize methods below.
207 FRIEND_TEST(SandboxTest, InitializationWithSize);
208 FRIEND_TEST(SandboxTest, PartiallyReservedSandbox);
209
210 // We allow tests to disable the guard regions around the sandbox. This is
211 // useful for example for tests like the SequentialUnmapperTest which track
212 // page allocations and so would incur a large overhead from the guard
213 // regions. The provided virtual address space must be able to allocate
214 // subspaces. The size must be a multiple of the allocation granularity of the
215 // virtual memory space.
216 bool Initialize(v8::VirtualAddressSpace* vas, size_t size,
217 bool use_guard_regions);
218
219 // Used when reserving virtual memory is too expensive. A partially reserved
220 // sandbox does not reserve all of its virtual memory and so doesn't have the
221 // desired security properties as unrelated mappings could end up inside of
222 // it and be corrupted. The size and size_to_reserve parameters must be
223 // multiples of the allocation granularity of the virtual address space.
224 bool InitializeAsPartiallyReservedSandbox(v8::VirtualAddressSpace* vas,
225 size_t size,
226 size_t size_to_reserve);
227
228 // Performs final initialization steps after the sandbox address space has
229 // been initialized. Called from the two Initialize variants above.
230 void FinishInitialization();
231
232 // Initialize the constant objects for this sandbox.
233 void InitializeConstants();
234
235 Address base_ = kNullAddress;
236 Address end_ = kNullAddress;
237 size_t size_ = 0;
238
239 // Base and size of the virtual memory reservation backing this sandbox.
240 // These can be different from the sandbox base and size due to guard regions
241 // or when a partially-reserved sandbox is used.
242 Address reservation_base_ = kNullAddress;
243 size_t reservation_size_ = 0;
244
245 bool initialized_ = false;
246
247 // The virtual address subspace backing the sandbox.
248 std::unique_ptr<v8::VirtualAddressSpace> address_space_;
249
250 // The page allocator instance for this sandbox.
251 std::unique_ptr<v8::PageAllocator> sandbox_page_allocator_;
252
253 // Constant objects inside this sandbox.
254 SandboxedPointerConstants constants_;
255};
256
257V8_EXPORT_PRIVATE Sandbox* GetProcessWideSandbox();
258
259#endif // V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
260
261// Helper function that can be used to ensure that certain objects are not
262// located inside the sandbox. Typically used for trusted objects.
263// Will always return false when the sandbox is disabled or partially reserved.
264V8_INLINE bool InsideSandbox(uintptr_t address) {
265#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
266 Sandbox* sandbox = GetProcessWideSandbox();
267 // Use ReservationContains (instead of just Contains) to correctly handle the
268 // case of partially-reserved sandboxes.
269 return sandbox->ReservationContains(address);
270#else
271 return false;
272#endif
273}
274
275V8_INLINE void* EmptyBackingStoreBuffer() {
276#ifdef V8_ENABLE_SANDBOX
277 return reinterpret_cast<void*>(
278 GetProcessWideSandbox()->constants().empty_backing_store_buffer());
279#else
280 return nullptr;
281#endif
282}
283
284} // namespace internal
285} // namespace v8
